name: Grid

props.name: adaptive
props.description: Auto switch to 1 column in portrait

props.name: compact
props.description: Compact zeros both pad and gap

props.name: normalizeRowHeights
props.description:
Normalize child heights per row by stretching items to match
the tallest in that row. Effective only when 2+ columns are active
(i.e., adaptive is off, or on but not collapsed to 1 column).
Defaults to true; set false to opt out.

props.name: preset
props.description: One or many style-preset names registered via `definePreset()`

props.name: pad
props.description: Container padding as units or CSS length.

props.name: gap
props.description: Inter-child spacing as units or CSS length.

bestPractices: Use Grid for two‑dimensional layouts like dashboards and galleries; keep rows and columns responsive.
Constrain item overflow and prefer consistent gaps; avoid nested scroll regions unless intentional.
Treat tabular data with `Table`; reserve Grid for cards and visual groups.
Use tokens and presets for spacing and breakpoints; avoid hard‑coding pixel values.
Keep density readable: don’t cram too many items per row on narrow screens.
Use `Stack` for simple one‑dimensional layouts; Grid for when both axes matter.
Mind a11y ordering: visual reflow should not break logical reading order.
Test at common breakpoints to ensure content doesn’t clip or overlap.

examples.title: Two columns
examples.code:
<Grid columns={2} gap={1}>
  <Box fullWidth centerContent preset='glassHolder'><Typography>A</Typography></Box>
  <Box fullWidth centerContent preset='glassHolder'><Typography>B</Typography></Box>
</Grid>

examples.title: Four columns
examples.code:
<Grid columns={4} gap={1}>
  {Array.from({ length: 8 }, (_, i) => i + 1).map(n => (
    <Box key={n} fullWidth centerContent preset='fancyHolder'><Typography>{n}</Typography></Box>
  ))}
</Grid>

examples.title: Adaptive (portrait collapses)
examples.code:
<Grid columns={4} gap={1} adaptive>
  {Array.from({ length: 8 }, (_, i) => i + 1).map(n => (
    <Box key={n} fullWidth centerContent preset='gradientHolder'><Typography>{n}</Typography></Box>
  ))}
</Grid>

examples.title: Nested grids
examples.code:
<Grid columns={2} gap={1}>
  <Grid columns={2} gap={1}>
    <Box fullWidth centerContent><Typography>A1</Typography></Box>
    <Box fullWidth centerContent><Typography>A2</Typography></Box>
    <Box fullWidth centerContent><Typography>A3</Typography></Box>
    <Box fullWidth centerContent><Typography>A4</Typography></Box>
  </Grid>
  <Grid columns={3} gap={0.5}>
    {['B1','B2','B3','B4','B5','B6'].map(n => (
      <Box key={n} fullWidth centerContent><Typography>{n}</Typography></Box>
    ))}
  </Grid>
</Grid>
